issue.title: Support basic array output types

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: request for unsupported feature or enhancement

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

body: @dashesy  -- from the link above, it seems like upgrading visual studio to 2017 15.5,  with support for C# 7.2 should solve the error above (you can still target older versions of .NET Core and Framework). Is that possibility?

I can use it in VS2015 too: 

```C#
var t = System.Numerics.Tensors.ArrayTensorExtensions.ToTensor(array).Reshape(new[] { 1, 3, image.Height, image.Width})
```

It would be nice to have utility functions to convert usual C# types to tensor though. I use unsafe code to convert Bitmap to tensor of bytes, if it was part of a utility in onnxruntime that would have been better. Also if we could use the underlying buffer of the bitmap to avoid copying that would have been even better.

Given a float[], it should be straightforward to create a Tensor(). 

Bitmap is an implementation of  System.Drawing.Image class. From a design perspective, implementing a ToTensor() method in the Bitmap class seems like a better route, because the memory layout  (i.e. channels-first/last, ordering of channels, resizing of image etc.) is better controlled from the bitmap class, than by a converter/constructor function in OnnxRuntime.

Are there any particular blockers (or is this mostly for convenience)?
Closing this out -- taking in float[] and bitmap structs will probably cause confusion, especially  since Onnxruntime is heavily tensor-centric.
